subject: AI
title: What Is AI Safety?
description: Preventing AI systems from causing unintended harm.

hook.text: A hiring AI rejects every resume from a certain zip code. Nobody programmed that rule â€” the model learned it from biased training data. The company faces a lawsuit.

buildup.text: AI safety is the practice of ensuring AI systems do what we intend, don't cause unintended harm, and remain under human control. It covers bias, security, privacy, misuse, and alignment.

discovery.text: Safety isn't just about killer robots. Most AI harms are mundane: biased decisions, privacy leaks, manipulative outputs, and automation of harmful content at scale.

twist.text: The safer an AI system appears, the more people trust it â€” and the more damage it causes when it fails. A system that's right 99% of the time still affects thousands of people in that 1%.

climax.text: AI safety is an engineering discipline, not just an ethics discussion. It requires specific tools, processes, and design decisions.

punchline.text: AI safety isn't optional. It's the difference between a useful tool and an uncontrolled liability.

quiz.question: What does AI safety primarily focus on?
options: Preventing unintended harm and keeping AI systems under human control
